bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, September 4, 1911

div1.p: Carter informs Laura Armistead Carter that his departure date is still uncertain and encourages her to regain her health.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, September 4, 1911
div1.opener:
Hotel Continental
Washington D.C.
Sept 4/11 About 3 P.M.
Dear Laura:
div1.p:
This is Labor-Day which I
did not know. Er-go the Depart.
is closed. I got Glennan on the
telephone. The orders are not yet
issued. He expected that they
would be tomorrow secured to
think it possible, that delay to
Oct 2nd leaving S. Fran'co would do
no harm: but could not say very
definitely. So at my own sug-
gestion I will remain over un-
til tomorrow morning meet him & Dr. W. then & leave
on the 4 P.M. train. This is
certainly best as the personal
interview is worth more than
the delay. And that is the only
loss, as I was able to cancel
my st Pullman Reserva-
tion or rather exchange it for
a reservation tomorrow.
Dr. Hamman, evidently is wil-
ling to let you go on the 10th or 11th.
1I mean thinks you can leave
then without undue risk, yet so
if it is the 19th all right. slifl

he said. “You” -meaning me- “can leave on the 19th
if specially inconvenient to post-
pone it”. However if it can
be postponed 13 days later it
will be better all around
you could say about a week or
10 days later & have a longer
rest or inter-
val any way - in Louisville
So IAlso better about Ned. So
I am satisfied any way.
Indeed my dear after the win-
ter we have passed it will be
like heaven to have you with
us well again & able to en-
joy things: with no stenogra-
phy & with, if it please God, Ned
not worrying us.
